reviews.review_msg: Dr. Ray is an amazing prof! I strongly suggest taking this class!

NOT the gpa booster ur looking for if ur not ready to read before each class, had her class online. was terrible, emailed her once for help, she posted an email informing everyone in the class to not email her w/ full rules (this was mid-semester). she's nice, cares but provides no feedback for grades or essays. cold calls on you, read beforehand.

It was an OK class, but very dry and she had really strange participation requirements -- you got extra credit for showing photos that you attended an Indian cultural event, or if you asked her questions about outside readings, but only got a B if you showed up to class, answered questions, and did the required reading. Hard pass.

Interesting subject, but poor delivery. Class average was B- to C+ range, with assignments being graded very harshly. Participation is 25% of grade, but it's not easy participation - you have to go to office hours, ask questions, show you've ready outside books, and even then you just get a B. Many students were discouraged. Not a GPA booster!

Very interesting class. She is kind and humorous. It is important to attend lectures, if you don't I don't think it would be easy to figure out exactly what the important material is (as there is no "real" chapter by chapter textbook). Would recommend.

she's the greatest. Her instructions are sometimes not the clearest but she's really approachable and engaging. Knows her stuff and wonderful sense of humor. Check ur email often and pay attention in lecture. Forgiving marker.
Love her teaching style. She's a real talented historian. I thoroughly enjoy listening to her talk about Indian history and her opinions.

loved this class! you can tell she knows her stuff and that she's really passionate about it too.. assignments aren't hard and the class itself was super interesting! would definitely take another class with her!
